okay now I'm going to show you the

you don't want that loop to cinch up
it's a strong knot it's easy to tie it's
easy to untie and you can even tie it
one-handed so one of the most common
mistakes with a bowline knot is that
when you make this loop you've got to
make it this way with this part on top
if you make it like this and you do
everything else exactly right it just
comes apart so remember you got to flip
it up now another common mistake with
the bowline knot is people will come
down and around and do this so you've
got one line in one line out and it
basically ends up collapsing into a
separate not okay and it's not a
catastrophic failure but remember flip
the loop on top comes up around and down
this is where you hear the things about

and he goes back down his hole that's

lot of strain so this is a great knot to
use in combination with the trucker's
hitch and because the loop doesn't cinch

person

the flying bow line or the tugboat bow
line is a different not than the
standard bow line you learned in Boy
Scouts
however this knot serves the same
function it creates a loop that doesn't
collapse in on itself so then if you
need to wrap it around something it'll
keep a strong loop that won't close in
on itself
however it's not particularly useful
because you can't feed the line through
something it's only good when you can
place the loop over something so if you
wanted to make a loop on the end of a
line to throw to somebody who's drowning
that works really well and the name the
tugboat bowline comes from the fact that
when you want to more up your boat or
you want to tow something you can put a
loop on the end of line fasten it on to
the dock or another boat and pull with
it it's very quick very easy but a
limited function there's a couple ways
to do the flying bowline but the easiest
way is to step on the working end with
your left foot and then grab the bitter
end or tag end with your right hand you
pull up a bite or a loop of rope with
your left hand and you wrap it around
and now you have two loops one in your
left hand one of your right hand take
the one in your right hand and feed it
through the loop in your left hand and
then pull holding the tag in and the
working end in the same right hand and
then you pull it tight and there you go
this is what the knot should look like
